item.title: COMPLAINING
item.description:
• Skill: Speaking
  • Level: Beginner
  • Goal: Speak English Fluently
  • Compiled by: Dian Budi Rahayu

COMPLAINING



You are going to practice how to complain something to other people.

Pay attention to the example below.



Situation


One morning you went to a toy story to buy a toy car which had some lights in different colors that would be shining if it is put a battery in the battery space. But when you tried to operate it at home, the lights did not shine. You tried to put another battery but it still did not work. The car seemed to be broken


After knowing the situation, you have to make a dialogue based on the situation. For the example:


Ben : Excuse me.

Mr. John : Yes boy, what can I do for you?

Ben : I was who just bought this toy car here.

Mr. John : Yes, what happen?

Ben : I just came back to home then tried to operate this toy car. But unfortunately the lights it has did not shine. I though it must be the battery I put in.

Mr .John : Are you sure? Have you tried to use another battery?

Ben : Yes, I’ve tried to change the battery but the lights did not work still. It seemed the car is broken. So how is the solution? Will the car be repaired or you give me the new one? This is the receipt sir.

Mr. John : Yes I see, sorry for the problem. Here it is, I give you the new one.

Ben : Thank you sir.

Mr. John : You’re welcome.


After making the dialogue, please practice it with your friend



IT IS TIME TO PRACTICE.





Situation 1:


Yesterday your mother went to a shoe shop. She bought a pair of shoes for you. When she arrived at home, you tried the shoes but the size was too small for you. So you could not wear the shoes. You wanted to complain and turned the shoes back without telling your mother. Fortunately the shop allows the customer to turn back the nonsense shoes had bought.

Make a dialogue contain tour complain based on the situation given!



Situation 2:


One evening, you went to a shop and you bought new T-shirt. You liked it very much but you forgot to check that T-shirt. When you arrived at home, unfortunately there was a part torn little.

Make a dialogue contain tour complain based on the situation given!



Complete this Task

Follow-up Activities

item.title: DESCRIPTIVE TEXT
item.description:
• Skill: Reading
  • Level: Beginner
  • Text: Descriptive Text
  • Compiled by: Bayu Aji Purbo P.

DESCRIPTIVE TEXT



The Definition and Purpose of Descriptive Text


Descriptive text is a text which says what a person or a thing is like. It covers the physical condition and characteristics of a person and a thing described. Its purpose is to describe and reveal a particular person, place, or thing clearly.

The Generic Structure of Descriptive Text


Identification:

identifying the phenomenon to be described.

Description:

describing the phenomenon in parts, qualities, or/and characteristics.

The features of Descriptive Text


1. Using attributive and identifying process.
2. Using descriptive adjectives and classifiers in nominal group.
3. Using simple present tense

Example:






Material Source →

Go to task 1

item.title: DESCRIPTIVE TEXT
item.description:
• Skill: Reading
  • Level: Beginner
  • Text: Descriptive Text
  • Theme: Animal
  • Compiled by: Bayu Aji Purbo P.

TASK 1



Read the following text carefully!



Cat


It is a cat. Cat is a tame animal. People like to keep it as a pet because it is cute.

Cat has four legs. It has a tail. It has soft fur and has many colors. Some are white, grey, black, yellow, orange, or mixed. It has moustache. Cat also has claws. It eats fish.



Answer these questions based on text above.



1. What does the text tell us about?

2. What does the 2nd paragraph tell us about?

3. What is the cat like to eat?

4. Does the cat have moustache?

5. Why do people like to have a cat?


Answers:



1. The text tell us about description of a cat

2. Characteristics of a cat

3. Cat like to eat fish

4. Yes, it does

5. Because it’s tame and cute


SHOW ANSWERS



Go to task 2

Source
LKS BIMA kelas 1,2 semester gasal
LKS Prima kelas 10 smt gasal

item.title: DESCRIPTIVE TEXT
item.description:
• Skill: Reading
  • Level: Beginner
  • Text: Descriptive Text
  • Theme: Animal
  • Compiled by: Bayu Aji Purbo P.

TASK 2



Read the following text carefully!



Rabbit


Rabbit belongs to tame animal. It is very cute. That is why people like to have rabbit as a pet.

Rabbit has long ears and two big teeth. It has small eyes and soft fur. Rabbit has short and round tail. It is herbivore. It usually eats carrots and vegetables. Rabbit has four legs and it moves by jumping



Answer these questions based on text above.



1. What does the text tell us about?

2. What does the 2nd paragraph tell us about?

3. What is the rabbit like to eat?

4. Rabbit loves to eat vegetables, what kind of animal it is?

5. How does rabbit moves?


Answers:



1. The text tell us about description of rabbit

2. Characteristics of rabbit

3. Carrots and vegetables

4. Herbivores

5. By jumping


SHOW ANSWERS



Complete this task

Source

LKS BIMA kelas 1,2 semester gasal

item.title: DESCRIPTIVE TEXT
item.description:
• Skill: Reading
  • Level: Beginner
  • Text: Descriptive Text
  • Compiled by: Mahatma Radea K.

DESCRIPTIVE TEXT



Descriptive Text


Descriptive text is a text to describe person, place or thing in detail.

The Generic Structure:



1. Identification :

identifies specific participant, contains general information

2. Description :

describe parts, qualities, and specific characteristics

The Social Function:

to describe person, place or thing in particular.

The Language Features:


1. Using Simple Present Tense
2. Using adjectives to describe characteristics.


Example:





Dog


Dog belongs to tame animal. It is very cute and loyal. That is why people like to have dog as a pet.

Dog has long tounge and sharp teeth. It has small eyes and soft fur. Dog has long and strong body. It is carnivore. It usually eats bone and meat. Dog has four legs and it moves really fast.



Source
LKS BIMA kelas 1,2 semester gasal
LKS Prima kelas 10 smt gasal



Go to task 1

item.title: DESCRIPTIVE TEXT
item.description:
• Skill: Reading
  • Level: Beginner
  • Text: Descriptive Text
  • Theme: Friends
  • Compiled by: Mahatma Radea K.

TASK 1



Read the following text carefully!



My Pen Friend


Ari is one of my pen friends. I met him when he visited his uncle in my town three years ago.

Ari’s address is at Daendels Street No 59, Ambal, Kebumen. He is a junior high school student. He goes to SMP 1 Ambal. Now, he is in the second year.

Ari is the same age as me. He is tall. It is about 165 centimeters tall. He has white complexion and short black hair. He is very kind and friendly. He also respectful. Besides, he is helpful too. I am glad to have such a friend.



Answer these questions based on text above.



1. Who is ari?

2. When was the writer met Ari?

3. Where does Ari live?

4. Is Ari an SMP student too?

5. What is the characteristic of Ari? (at least 2 characteristics)


Answers:



1. The writer’s pen friend

2. Three years ago

3. at Daendels Street No 59, Ambal, Kebumen

4. Yes, he is

5. He is tall. It is about 165 centimeters tall. He has white complexion and short black hair. He is very kind and friendly. He also respectful. Besides, he is helpful too


SHOW ANSWERS


Source
LKS BIMA kelas 1,2 semester gasal
LKS Prima kelas 10 smt gasal


Go to task 2

item.title: DESCRIPTIVE TEXT
item.description:
• Skill: Reading
  • Level: Beginner
  • Text: Descriptive Text
  • Theme: Animal
  • Compiled by: Mahatma Radea K.

TASK 2



Read the following text carefully!



Girrafes


Giraffes are the most interesting animal I saw in the safari park last holiday. There are two giraffes there. One is male, and the other one is female. They are very tall. Even, they are the tallest animals in the world.

The male is about 5,5 meters tall and about 1360 kilograms weight. While the female is about 4,87 meters and about 1200 kilograms weight. Both of them have horns, although the horns of female are smaller and shorter.

The giraffes have spots covering their entire bodies, except the underbellies. They have long neck. The male’s neck will continue to increase throughout its twenty-plus years of life. They use the neck to browse the leaves of tree. Besides, the male uses the long neck to combat and competition. Each of the giraffe can eat 63 kilograms of leaves and twigs daily.

The giraffes defend themselves against threat by kicking with great force. A single-placed kick of an adult giraffe can shalter a lion’s skull or break its spine.



Answer these questions simply and correctly.



1. Which paragraph is called the identification?

2. Where did the writer saw giraffes?

3. How many giraffes are there?

4. Do they have horns?

5. Which giraffes is taller and bigger?

6. How many kilograms of leaves and twigs are the giraffes usually eat a day?

7. “….entire bodies, except the underbellies.” (paragraph 3, line 1) What is the synonym of the underlined word (underbellies)?

Answers:



1. 1st paragraph

2. at Safari Park

3. Two girrafes

4. Yes, they do

5. Male Girrafe

6. 63 Kgs a day

7. Stomach



SHOW ANSWERS (1-7)

6. Which paragraphs is called description?

a. 1-3
b. 2-4
c. 3-4
d. 1-4

7. How tall is the male giraffes? It is … meters tall.

a. 5,5
b. 4,87
c. 63
d. 1,36

8. How weight is the female giraffes? It is … kilograms weight.

a. 1360
b. 1630
c. 1200
d. 1100

9. How is the female’s horns like? It is …

a. Smaller and taller than male
b. Smaller than male
c. Shorter than male
d. Smaller and shorter than male

10. What do the giraffes use their long necks for?
The answers are true except….

a. For fighting
b. For annoying others
c. For having competition
d. For browing the leaves

11. The male’s neck will continue to increase throughout its twenty-plus years of life. (paragraph 3 line 3). What does the word ‘its’ refer to?

a. The horn
b. The giraffe’s body
c. The underbellies
d. The giraffe’s neck

12. “…shalter a lion’s skull or break its spine.” (paragraph 4 line 2). What is the synonym of the underlined word (skull)?

a. neck
b. hair
c. bone
d. Eyes

Wrong answers will be marked with red color
Correct answers will be marked with green color



Complete this task Check Answer



Source
LKS BIMA kelas 1,2 semester gasal
LKS Prima kelas 10 smt gasal

item.title: DESCRIPTIVE TEXT
item.description:
• Skill: Reading
  • Level: Beginner
  • Text: Recount Text
  • Theme: Vacation
  • Compiled by: Mahatma Radea K.

TASK 1



Read the following text carefully!



Going to The Zoo


Last New Year holiday Ika, Ida, Deni, and Eko went to the Zoo. They went there by motorcycles. They left their house at 08.00 a.m. and got there at 10.00 a.m. after parking their motorcycles, they went to the ticket window to buy tickets. They should show them to the guard before entering the zoo.

Firstly, they went to the cage of the dangerous animals. There were five cages. They are two for lions, two for leopards, and one for a panther. All of the animals looked strong and fierce. There was some meat in the lion’s cage. It seemed that thee keeper had just given them food but they didn’t eat it all.

After seeing the dangerous animals they went to the monkey’s cage. There were a lot of monkeys in it. They were not afraid of visitors. Even they approach them as if they asked for something. Ika bought some peanuts to the food seller who walk around the cage and throw them to the monkeys. They caught the peanuts and ate them happily.

They walked around the zoo to see all animals. Ida took the picture of some animals. She took the picture of an elephant with Ika on its back. It looked dangerous but funny.

After walking around the zoo for two hours, they felt tired. Then they dropped in the Javanese Food Restaurant to take a rest. They also have lunch there.

When the day was getting dark they went home. All of them felt happy and sattisfied.



Answer these questions based on text above.



1. Who went to the zoo?

2. When did they arrived in the zoo?

3. How many cages are there in the zoo?

4. Who took picture in the zoo?

5. How do they felt after they went to the zoo?


Answers:



1. Ika, Ida, Deni, and Eko

2. At 10 a.m.

3. five cages

4. Ida did

5. Tired but happy


SHOW ANSWERS


Go to task 2


Source
LKS BIMA kelas 1,2 semester gasal
LKS Prima kelas 10 smt gasal

item.title: DESCRIPTIVE TEXT
item.description:
• Skill: Reading
  • Level: Beginner
  • Text: Recount Text
  • Theme: Vacation
  • Compiled by: Mahatma Radea K.

TASK 2



Read the following text carefully!



Trip to Bali


Last holiday I had a vacation with my family. My father and I decided to go to Bali. We went to Bali by plane, but after I arrived in Bali we took the trip by car.

We spent there for 6 days. We stayed at our resort during the trip. We visited many tourism spots. We visited Besakih Temple, Sanur and Kuta beaches. We also visited Tampaskiring and of course we never forget to go shopping in the most well known Shopping center in Bali, Joger.

That was a very marvelous trip I ever did, even after we went home we are so tired but its fun.



Answer these questions based on text above.



1. What is the type of the text above?

2. Who was going to Bali?

3. When did they go to Bali?

4. How many days did the writer spent the holiday?

5. How did the writer feel?


Answers:



1. Recount text

2. The writer and the writer’s/his/her family

3. Last holiday

4. Six days

5. The writer/he/she felt happy


SHOW ANSWERS




Go to task 3 Source
LKS BIMA kelas 1,2 semester gasal
LKS Prima kelas 10 smt gasal

item.title: DESCRIPTIVE TEXT
item.description:
• Skill: Reading
  • Grade: 2nd Grade of SMP
  • Text: Desxiptive Text
  • Theme: Family
  • Created by: Mercy Dwi

DESCRIPTIVE TEXT



Definition:


A text which describing a person, thing, animal or place. The purpose is to describe a particular person, place, thing, etc.



Generic Structure:



Identification

It is a part that contains introduces or identifies the characterr that will be described.


Description

It is a part that contains an explanation, describe, characteristic related the topic.



Language Features:


- using simple present tense
- using adjective, noun (as a subject)



Here I will give you an example of descriptive text so that you can be easy to learn and understand about descriptive text.



go to task 1

item.title: DESCRIPTIVE TEXT
item.description:
• Skill: Reading
  • Grade: 2nd Grade of SMP
  • Text: Descriptive Text
  • Theme: Family
  • Created by: Mercy Dwi

TASK 1



I. Read the following text carefully!



My Father


My father’s name is Gunawan. People usually call him Mr. Gun. He is very patient and handsome.

My father is 40 years old. He was born in Surabaya, one of a big cities in Indonesia. My father moved to Jember when I was in Secondary School. My father is a teacher. He teaches English at SMP 2 Jember. He goes to school before 7 a.m. My father’s hobby is fishing. He spends the weekend to go fishing. He often goes fishing in the sea.



II. Choose the correct answer by choosing a, b, c, or d!




1. How old is he?
a. 39 years old
b. 40 years old
c. 41 years old
d. 30 years old

2. Where was he born?
a. Jember
b. Malang
c. Surabaya
d. Jakarta

3. What is his hobby?
a. Teaching
b. Fishing
c. Singing
d. Travelling

4. What is Mr. Gunawan’s job?
a. A doctor
b. A fisherman
c. A policeman
d. a teacher

5. Where does he teach?
a. At SMA 2 Jember
b. At MTs 2 Jember
c. at SMP 2 Jember
d. at MA 2 Jember




Wrong answers will be marked with red color
Correct answers will be marked with green color


Go to task 2 Check Answer
